alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee; Racine; Walworth; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 3:37AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Milwaukee, northeastern Walworth, northwestern Racine and southern Waukesha Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 337 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over North Prairie, or near Mukwonago, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Milwaukee, Waukesha, West Allis, New Berlin, Greenfield, Muskego, Greendale, Hales Corners, Mukwonago, East Troy, West Milwaukee, Franklin, Wind Lake, Vernon, Ottawa, Raymond, North Prairie, Big Bend, Waterford North and Potter Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
